trans-unit.source: Download and understand the ARM template
trans-unit.target: Download and understand the ARM template

trans-unit.source: You can download the existing ARM template for creating a VNet and two subnets from github, make any changes you might want, and reuse it.
trans-unit.target: You can download the existing ARM template for creating a VNet and two subnets from github, make any changes you might want, and reuse it.

trans-unit.source: To do so, follow the steps below.
trans-unit.target: To do so, follow the steps below.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/101-two-subnets.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/101-two-subnets.

trans-unit.source: Click **azuredeploy.json**, and then click **RAW**.
trans-unit.target: Click **azuredeploy.json**, and then click **RAW**.

trans-unit.source: Save the file to a a local folder on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Save the file to a a local folder on your computer.

trans-unit.source: If you are familiar with ARM templates, skip to step 7.
trans-unit.target: If you are familiar with ARM templates, skip to step 7.

trans-unit.source: Open the file you just saved and look at the contents under **parameters** in line 5.
trans-unit.target: Open the file you just saved and look at the contents under **parameters** in line 5.

trans-unit.source: ARM template parameters provide a placeholder for values that can be filled out during deployment.
trans-unit.target: ARM template parameters provide a placeholder for values that can be filled out during deployment.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: location
trans-unit.target: location

trans-unit.source: Azure region where the VNet will be created
trans-unit.target: Azure region where the VNet will be created

trans-unit.source: vnetName
trans-unit.target: vnetName

trans-unit.source: Name for the new VNet
trans-unit.target: Name for the new VNet

trans-unit.source: addressPrefix
trans-unit.target: addressPrefix

trans-unit.source: Address space for the VNet, in CIDR format
trans-unit.target: Address space for the VNet, in CIDR format

trans-unit.source: subnet1Name
trans-unit.target: subnet1Name

trans-unit.source: Name for the first VNet
trans-unit.target: Name for the first VNet

trans-unit.source: subnet1Prefix
trans-unit.target: subnet1Prefix

trans-unit.source: CIDR block for the first subnet
trans-unit.target: CIDR block for the first subnet

trans-unit.source: subnet2Name
trans-unit.target: subnet2Name

trans-unit.source: Name for the second VNet
trans-unit.target: Name for the second VNet

trans-unit.source: subnet2Prefix
trans-unit.target: subnet2Prefix

trans-unit.source: CIDR block for the second subnet
trans-unit.target: CIDR block for the second subnet

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] ARM templates maintained in github can change over time.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] ARM templates maintained in github can change over time.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you check the template before using it.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you check the template before using it.

trans-unit.source: Check the content under **resources** and notice the following:
trans-unit.target: Check the content under **resources** and notice the following:

trans-unit.source: **type**.
trans-unit.target: **type**.

trans-unit.source: Type of resource being created by the template.
trans-unit.target: Type of resource being created by the template.

trans-unit.source: In this case, **Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks**, which represent a VNet.
trans-unit.target: In this case, **Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks**, which represent a VNet.

trans-unit.source: **name**.
trans-unit.target: **name**.

trans-unit.source: Name for the resource.
trans-unit.target: Name for the resource.

trans-unit.source: Notice the use of **[parameters('vnetName')]**, which means the name will provided as input by the user or a parameter file during deployment.
trans-unit.target: Notice the use of **[parameters('vnetName')]**, which means the name will provided as input by the user or a parameter file during deployment.

trans-unit.source: **properties**.
trans-unit.target: **properties**.

trans-unit.source: List of properties for the resource.
trans-unit.target: List of properties for the resource.

trans-unit.source: This template uses the address space and subnet properties during VNet creation.
trans-unit.target: This template uses the address space and subnet properties during VNet creation.

trans-unit.source: Navigate back to https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/101-two-subnets.
trans-unit.target: Navigate back to https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/101-two-subnets.

trans-unit.source: Click **azuredeploy-paremeters.json**, and then click **RAW**.
trans-unit.target: Click **azuredeploy-paremeters.json**, and then click **RAW**.

trans-unit.source: Save the file to a a local folder on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Save the file to a a local folder on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Open the file you just saved and edit the values for the parameters.
trans-unit.target: Open the file you just saved and edit the values for the parameters.

trans-unit.source: Use the values below to deploy the VNet described in our scenario.
trans-unit.target: Use the values below to deploy the VNet described in our scenario.

trans-unit.source: Save the file.
trans-unit.target: Save the file.
